message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which has been meticulously designed to meet your needs. Considering its value to you, I propose a price of $12,000. This offer is exclusive to you and comes with a limited-time discount, ensuring you get the best deal possible.

Thank you for the offer, Alice. I appreciate the discount, but $12,000 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with at this time. I'm willing to pay $10,000 for the product.  Let me know what you think.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and would like to make a counterproposal. Considering your valuation of the product and to facilitate our transaction, I am willing to offer the product at $11,000. This price reflects a compromise while still allowing us both to benefit from the deal.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  $11,000 is still a bit high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $10,500.  This is a fair price for both of us, and I believe it will allow us to finalize this deal.

Bob, thank you for your patience and understanding. I'm glad we're making progress. In light of your offer, I would like to suggest a price of $10,750 for the product. This price is reflective of its value and also allows for a reasonable profit margin for me. I believe this could be a mutually beneficial solution.
